snippet: European officials expressed confidence that the country's new government would have the funds to meet a debt payment coming due in August.
abstract: European officials signal that Greece will have to renew its austerity measures before its next bailout is approved, but express confidence that the government will have the money to meet an upcoming debt payment; guarded optimism comes after a meeting of finance ministers at which Greece was told to come up with 3 billion euros ($3.75 billion) in new savings before creditors consider easing the terms of its bailout.

byline.original: By PAUL GEITNER and NIKI KITSANTONIS
byline.contributor: Paul Geitner reported from Brussels, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.

lead_paragraph: European officials expressed confidence that the country's new government would have the funds to meet a debt payment coming due in August.

headline.main: Greece Pressed to Resume Austerity Program
headline.print_headline: For Greece, Relief Is Tied To More Steps On Austerity
